intro: Tritelandra, commonly known as the "tropical orchid," is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly Central and South America, where they thrive in humid, tropical climates. Tritelandra species are characterized by their showy, often fragrant flowers, which come in a variety of colors including white, yellow, and orange. They typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, attaching themselves to trees or rocks in their natural habitats. Due to their ornamental value, some species are cultivated in gardens and greenhouses around the world.
